Articles.Content:
So the devs just released a new blog post, which talks about their panel at SXSW a bit, and also reveals a bit more about the asteroid redirect mission. It's all well and good (interestingly, we appear to have to identify asteroids before we can visit them) until the last couple of sentences. Specifically:

Another new part is the robotic grappling device, which players will use to snare the rock and redirect it into orbit around the Mun, Kerbin or other planets. This new device can also grab things other than asteroids, making it one of the most versatile parts added to the game.

Naturally, all I can think about when I read that is the Canadarm:

Any thoughts on what a stock robotic arm might look and act like?

Edited March 5, 2014 by purpletarget
Closing tags
so exciting! eee!
YAY YAY YAY YAY I have been waiting for this for SO long
My body is ready. Maybe now I can have a robotic arm that DOESN'T explode when you stick a clamp-o-tron Jr. on the end and dock with it.
When I first read it, I thought of how useful it would be for space station construction, etc. Then I looked up that picture and realized that 90% of its use will be flinging kerbals around!

Any thoughts on what a stock robotic arm might look and act like?

I have a feeling it's not going to be nearly as exciting or as flexible as you think it'll be. I'm guessing something that can basically extend, attach, and not much else.

That in itself is very useful and could be a great help in assemblingg stations.
A grapple does not equal a robotic arm. I'm envisioning a fishing line with a piece of gum on it that Jeb dangles out of the hatch.

That in itself is very useful and could be a great help in assemblingg stations.
